item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Monday, April 14, 2025 at 5:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. GPT-4.1 in the API (43 points | 21 comments)
2. The Path to Open-Sourcing the DeepSeek Inference Engine (114 points | 4 comments)
3. A hackable AI assistant using a single SQLite table and a handful of cron jobs (246 points | 61 comments)
4. Show HN: Zero-codegen, no-compile TypeScript type inference from Protobufs (32 points | 10 comments)
5. DolphinGemma: How Google AI is helping decode dolphin communication (102 points | 26 comments)
6. Hassabis Says Google DeepMind to Support Anthropic's MCP for Gemini and SDK (57 points | 3 comments)
7. Scientists: Protein IL-17 fights infection, acts on the brain, inducing anxiety (32 points | 7 comments)
8. SQLite File Format Viewer (35 points | 7 comments)
9. Meilisearch – search engine API bringing AI-powered hybrid search (68 points | 33 comments)
10. Show HN: Single-Header Profiler for C++17 (17 points | 2 comments)
11. Kezurou-Kai #39 (230 points | 19 comments)
12. Omnom: Self-hosted bookmarking with searchable, wysiwyg snapshots [showcase] (97 points | 36 comments)
13. Socketcluster: Highly scalable pub/sub and RPC SDK (8 points | 1 comment)
14. OpenAI Is a Systemic Risk to the Tech Industry (39 points | 26 comments)
15. Cure ID App Lets Clinicians Report Novel Uses of Existing Drugs (27 points | 15 comments)

19. Open guide to equity compensation (565 points | 256 comments)
20. Mario Vargas Llosa has died (178 points | 62 comments)
21. Functional Programming Lessons Conclusion (8 points | 1 comment)
22. Show HN: Resurrecting Infocom's Unix Z-Machine with Cosmopolitan (134 points | 39 comments)
23. Hacktical C: practical hacker's guide to the C programming language (111 points | 70 comments)
24. New Vulnerability in GitHub Copilot, Cursor: Hackers Can Weaponize Code Agents (173 points | 102 comments)
25. Show HN: I made a free tool that analyzes SEC filings and posts detailed reports (246 points | 66 comments)
26. Googler... ex-Googler (775 points | 675 comments)
27. AES and ChaCha (8 points | discuss)
28. Zig's new LinkedList API (it's time to learn fieldParentPtr) (139 points | 110 comments)
29. NoProp: Training neural networks without back-propagation or forward-propagation (139 points | 40 comments)
30. Dead trees keep surprisingly large amounts of carbon out of atmosphere (55 points | 44 comments)
